posts.author: ratty_uk2011
posts.content:
Morning all

Assuming Martial weapons only, and I'll be crafting something (hopefully) so stats are a wash. 

Great axe / great sword vs heavy flail for WoG ? 

Cheers!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I have two great sword characters. Arcane Dwarven Dreadlord and modified Mithdradates The Enforcer. They have dev crit and access to keen edge so thats why I chose that weapon. 

Their best weapon LOL is +4 greatsword but if I had reliable access to GMW 15 i could use some lesser weapons with added elemental damage... erm until I get mord'ed...

I think some of the more experienced WoG players should comment on this - I think one could use any weapon really

I have a particular weakness for small characters wielding scimitars in two hands...

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Greatsword, for playability/availability reasons.

Although, the Epic Greataxe, is a thing of beauty, for getting there...Greatsword.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I saw a good Halberd or two out there in WoG too

I thought it might be a problem if an enemy has resistance to both piercing and slashing

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
The best weapons are those who assemble or find yourself anyway.

I once found a "mercenary" blade with five or six sockets, can't remember exactly.
I went then & opened the secret chest I had, full of gems  that I gathered from countless battles (partner also helped with his), but never used till then & managed to add +20 elemental/divine dmg to that thing...
Then used umd to turn that thing into +5, flaming-weapon, keen-edge, +20 elemental/divine dmg Greatsword.
I was playing Lord Soth (Ftr/Rog/BG) so I had something like 40+ strength & divine might & sneak-attack & IKD & devastating critical & that weapon.
Each hit, was like a damn THUNDERSTRIKE!
Hit & Fatality.

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content:
Valerfor, Out of the corners of my mind I remember the name Lord Soth, but I cannot recall from where it comes, so I ask you where?
And of course I want to know what build you mean.

On Greyhawk, I often choose Greataxe over Greatsword, but I do not use devastating critical.
My reasoning is, "Which enemies do 'I' concern myself with the most, that half orc bandit with the sword, or the half orc bandit with the Greataxe? For me it is the greataxe wielder. The greatsword is more reliably putting out more damage, but damage that is easier to mitigate. When the greataxe crits, YOU or your enemy has much less time to try and drink healing potions/full heals/etc. At least it is so for me, and I have a great time playing GreatAxe weapon masters.

Good point!
It makes me wonder if there are any great scythes for even more carnage.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I think this is Valerfor's Lord Soth build?

Looks wicked to me 

the-antipaladin-infernal-devastator-ftr ... 51520.html

greataxe or scythe sounds really awesome. those x4 and x5 modifiers :)

We should be asking DMs to build more scythe wielding opponents who can keen their weapons :)

Spear doesn't sound too bad actually with a x3 modifier but I don't think it looks as cool? Something about it just doesnt cut it for me, I don't quite understand

Heavy flail on the other hand... :) I like. wish it could be keen weapon'ed though

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
gkorjax wrote: Valerfor, Out of the corners of my mind I remember the name Lord Soth, but I cannot recall from where it comes, so I ask you where?
And of course I want to know what build you mean.

On Greyhawk, I often choose Greataxe over Greatsword, but I do not use devastating critical.
My reasoning is, "Which enemies do 'I' concern myself with the most, that half orc bandit with the sword, or the half orc bandit with the Greataxe? For me it is the greataxe wielder. The greatsword is more reliably putting out more damage, but damage that is easier to mitigate. When the greataxe crits, YOU or your enemy has much less time to try and drink healing potions/full heals/etc. At least it is so for me, and I have a great time playing GreatAxe weapon masters.
The build was the one Orion linked but I went with even bigger strength 17(32), by sacrificing the esf:taunt for another great str.

Lord Soth is from the Dragonlance modules/novels of TSR era.
A bad-ass Ex-Paladin - now a Death-Knight, that has to listen to spirits each night moaning about his sins in life forever.
The Queen of Darkness herself tried to coerce him into joinning her forces in the upcoming war of the lance & he just told her to piss off (He doesn't care if he dies, for him is salvation).

Like a Boss

posts.author: Orion
posts.content: You've made me want to make a blackguard now, what a cool character concept!
